import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter rows where 'sensemaking' is in the 'AuthorKeywords'
df['Contains_Sensemaking'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)

# Group by year and count occurrences of 'sensemaking'
sensemaking_trend = df[df['Contains_Sensemaking']].groupby('Year').size()

# Plot the trend
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sensemaking_trend.plot(kind='bar', color='skyblue')
plt.title("Frequency of 'sensemaking' in AuthorKeywords Over the Years")
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

# Print the facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Frequency of 'sensemaking' in AuthorKeywords by Year:")
print(sensemaking_trend)
print("### End of facts")

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to 'sensemaking'
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract authors and years
authors_years = sensemaking_papers[['AuthorNames', 'Year']]

# Split authors and create a list of (author, year) tuples
author_year_list = []
for _, row in authors_years.iterrows():
    authors = row['AuthorNames'].split(';')
    year = row['Year']
    for author in authors:
        author_year_list.append((author.strip(), year))

# Count the frequency of each author
author_counts = Counter([author for author, _ in author_year_list])

# Get the most frequent authors
top_authors = author_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of their contributions over the years
author_years_df = pd.DataFrame(author_year_list, columns=['Author', 'Year'])

author_evolution = {}
for author, _ in top_authors:
    yearly_counts = author_years_df[author_years_df['Author'] == author]['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()
    author_evolution[author] = yearly_counts

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most frequent authors contributing to 'sensemaking':")
for author, count in top_authors:
    print(f"{author}: {count} papers")

print("\nEvolution of their contributions over the years:")
for author, yearly_counts in author_evolution.items():
    print(f"\n{author}:")
    for year, count in yearly_counts.items():
        print(f"{year}: {count} paper(s)")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to 'sensemaking'
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract authors and years
authors_years = sensemaking_papers[['AuthorNames', 'Year']]

# Split authors and create a list of (author, year) tuples
author_year_list = []
for _, row in authors_years.iterrows():
    authors = row['AuthorNames'].split(';')
    year = row['Year']
    for author in authors:
        author_year_list.append((author.strip(), year))

# Count the frequency of each author
author_counts = Counter([author for author, _ in author_year_list])

# Get the most frequent authors
top_authors = author_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of their contributions over the years
author_years_df = pd.DataFrame(author_year_list, columns=['Author', 'Year'])

author_evolution = {}
for author, _ in top_authors:
    yearly_counts = author_years_df[author_years_df['Author'] == author]['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()
    author_evolution[author] = yearly_counts

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most frequent authors contributing to 'sensemaking':")
for author, count in top_authors:
    print(f"{author}: {count} papers")

print("\nEvolution of their contributions over the years:")
for author, yearly_counts in author_evolution.items():
    print(f"\n{author}:")
    for year, count in yearly_counts.items():
        print(f"{year}: {count} paper(s)")
print("### End of facts")

import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers authored by Chris North and Alex Endert
authors_of_interest = ['Chris North', 'Alex Endert']
filtered_df = df[df['AuthorNames'].apply(lambda x: any(author in x for author in authors_of_interest))]

# Extract years and keywords related to sensemaking
years = filtered_df['Year']
keywords = filtered_df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(', ')

# Flatten the list of keywords and filter those related to sensemaking
sensemaking_keywords = [kw for sublist in keywords for kw in sublist if 'sensemaking' in kw]

# Count the frequency of sensemaking-related keywords over the years
keyword_trends = Counter(zip(years, sensemaking_keywords))

# Display the evolution of sensemaking-related themes
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Evolution of sensemaking-related themes over the years:")
for (year, keyword), count in keyword_trends.items():
    print(f"Year: {year}, Keyword: {keyword}, Count: {count}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: Who are the most frequent authors contributing to the research on 'sensemaking' in the dataset, and how has their contribution evolved over the years?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to 'sensemaking'
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract authors and years
authors_years = sensemaking_papers[['AuthorNames', 'Year']]

# Split authors and create a list of (author, year) tuples
author_year_list = []
for _, row in authors_years.iterrows():
    authors = row['AuthorNames'].split(';')
    year = row['Year']
    for author in authors:
        author_year_list.append((author.strip(), year))

# Count the frequency of each author
author_counts = Counter([author for author, _ in author_year_list])

# Get the most frequent authors
top_authors = author_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of their contributions over the years
author_years_df = pd.DataFrame(author_year_list, columns=['Author', 'Year'])

author_evolution = {}
for author, _ in top_authors:
    yearly_counts = author_years_df[author_years_df['Author'] == author]['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()
    author_evolution[author] = yearly_counts

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most frequent authors contributing to 'sensemaking':")
for author, count in top_authors:
    print(f"{author}: {count} papers")

print("\nEvolution of their contributions over the years:")
for author, yearly_counts in author_evolution.items():
    print(f"\n{author}:")
    for year, count in yearly_counts.items():
        print(f"{year}: {count} paper(s)")
print("### End of facts")

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_050727/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to 'sensemaking'
sensemaking_papers = df[df['Abstract'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract authors and years
authors_years = sensemaking_papers[['AuthorNames', 'Year']]

# Split authors and create a list of (author, year) tuples
author_year_list = []
for _, row in authors_years.iterrows():
    authors = row['AuthorNames'].split(';')
    year = row['Year']
    for author in authors:
        author_year_list.append((author.strip(), year))

# Count the frequency of each author
author_counts = Counter([author for author, _ in author_year_list])

# Get the most frequent authors
top_authors = author_counts.most_common(5)

# Analyze the evolution of their contributions over the years
author_years_df = pd.DataFrame(author_year_list, columns=['Author', 'Year'])

author_evolution = {}
for author, _ in top_authors:
    yearly_counts = author_years_df[author_years_df['Author'] == author]['Year'].value_counts().sort_index()
    author_evolution[author] = yearly_counts

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most frequent authors contributing to 'sensemaking':")
for author, count in top_authors:
    print(f"{author}: {count} papers")

print("\nEvolution of their contributions over the years:")
for author, yearly_counts in author_evolution.items():
    print(f"\n{author}:")
    for year, count in yearly_counts.items():
        print(f"{year}: {count} paper(s)")
print("### End of facts")

for (year, keyword), count in keyword_trends.items():
    print(f"Year: {year}, Keyword: {keyword}, Count: {count}")
print("### End of facts")
